lines.text: Bushwhackin'! Backshootin'! That's all the young ones know these days. They got no dignity! They got no pride! It just ain't no fun anymore.
You gave me your word not to try anything, and the minute I turned my back you almost took my head off.
I didn't give you my word - I gave you my promise.
It's the same thing!
No it ain't - one's my promise, and the other's my word!
Who the hell is John McKay?

[later]
Who the hell is James Flagg?
You got a privy out back?
The name of this town is Progress - there's one inside.
*In*side?
Yeah, just under the staircase.

[McKay jiggles the handcuffs; Flagg unlocks them and follows as McKay walks to the staircase]
You gonna hold my hand?

[McKay walks into the bathroom and looks around. He pulls the chain on the toilet, which flushes]
I'll be damned.

[talking about the plan to stop the train]
Why don't you take McKay here with you?
He's one of 'em!
No he isn't... not any more... are you, Mr. McKay?
No, ma'am... not after they shot Grundy...

There's only one plan and it's as plain as the nose on your face. You can't stop the train from comin' to town 'cause they got the telegraph covered. What you gotta do is stop the train from *stoppin* in town.
Waco!
[holds his right hand over his gun, challenging Waco]
You got style, McKay; I'll give you that much.

[Waco shoots first and wounds McKay. McKay pivots, fires, and kills Waco]
I thought I could beat 'im.
You beat him.
